purchase 17 self-contained breathing apparatuses, U.S. Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand announced today. The new breathing apparatuses will replace the fire company's 13-year-old air packs, and increase the overall safety of Mottville's 35 volunteer firefighters. It's going to help keep all the firefighters safe so they can enter burning buildings with the latest technology in air packs, Mottville volunteer Fire Chief Tim Baker said. The fire department has applied for the same federal grant for the last six years. Baker said his department needed to replace the aging technology and now the cost

Labour's deputy leader, Harriet Harman , told Sky News's Murnaghan programme: Hacking into people's phones is illegal. Obviously the criminal law has got to be complied with and if it is broken then it should be investigated by the police and it should be enforced. "Nobody is above the law, no newspaper editor, no journalist... for all of David Cameron 's talk of trust in politics, it's fundamental that people obey the law and that's what's at risk here. He should never have appointed him, she said, referring to Andy Coulson . Gordon Brown asked police to investigate whether he was a victim of phone hacking.
